author: Staff Reporter
text:
The former Chief Minister and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot, on Wednesday termed the decisions of the Rajasthan Cabinet to relocate and rename a tribal university, and to merge a journalism university with the Rajasthan University as “unfortunate.”

On Tuesday, the Rajasthan Cabinet decided that the Tribal University established during the Ashok Gehlot government would be shifted from Udaipur to an interior area of Banswara.

Varsity renamed

It was also decided that the name of the university would be changed from Rajiv Gandhi Tribal University to Govind Guru Tribal University (named after a tribal leader).

In another Cabinet decision, it was decided that the Haridev Joshi University of Journalism and Mass Communication (HJUJ), would be merged into the Jaipur University.

Blow to Congress

The decisions came as a personal blow to the Congress since both universities were set up in the year 2012 by the Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in Rajasthan.

Stating a previous instance where names were changed by the Vasundhara Raje government, Mr. Gehlot said, “Over 9,000 centres named ‘Rajiv Gandhi Seva Kendra’ were set up at various panchayats and district headquarters, however, she [Vasundhara Raje] changed the names to ‘Atal Seva Kendra’.”
title: Gehlot flays decision to relocate varsity
